channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: 'Happee Birthdae' to Harry Potter! Where to stream movies, celebrate
item.description: Don your birthday hats and grab your wands — it's time to wish a "Happee Birthdae" to one of the most iconic characters in pop culture.

item.title: 5 best things to do in Sarasota area this weekend (July 31-Aug. 3)

item.title: Here's the 2025 team-by-team Sarasota and Manatee high school football schedules
item.description: The 2025 high school football season begins with Florida High School Athletic Association Kickoff Classics on Aug. 14. The regular season begins Aug. 21 and runs through Oct. 31 (with the exception of IMG which will play into November) with most teams playing 10 games in 11 weeks.

item.title: Can Trump fire Jerome Powell, whom he nominated in his…
item.description: Despite ongoing pressure from PresidentDonald Trump, the Federal Reserve kept itskey interest rate unchangedon July 30, prompting the president to recycle his attack against the Fed chair,Jerome “Too Late” Powell.

item.title: Free speech group rates college policies: What rating is…
item.description: A nationalFirst Amendment advocacy groupgave fourFlorida universities"green lights" in its annual review of colleges' policies across the country that restrictfree speech and expression rights.

item.title: Manatee County plans to purchase Mixon Fruit Farms property amid audit
item.description: Manatee County commissionersreturned to work July 29understate pressure to cut spending, but that did not stop purchase a $13.5 million purchase of the Mixon Fruit Farms property to build a library, even though it may need to withstand Florida Department of Government Efficiency scrutiny.
